metadata.title: Tuesday, 6th June, 2023
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct additional communication towers in the following areas in Kanchibiya Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Kabinga Chiefdom; (ii) Kabulamwiko in Chief Mpepo’s Chiefdom; (iii) Cheweshimfwamba in Chief Luchembe’s Chiefdom; (iv) Chikakala in Chief Mpepo’s Chiefdom; and
(v) Munikashi and other areas in Senior Chief Kopa’s Chiefdom; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) what the total number of early childhood education centres in Kalabo District was, as of February, 2022;
(b) what the total number of teachers at the centres was, as of the same date;
(c) whether the number at (b) was adequate;
(d) if not, whether the Government has any plans to deploy additional teachers; and
(e) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Rural Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a road to connect Nkhankha and Luangwa Wards in Chama North Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to upgrade the Nsama Rural Health Centre in Nsama District to a mini hospital;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) whether the upgrade will include construction of a mortuary;
(d) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(e) what the estimated time frame for the completion of the project is.

(a) whether the Government is aware that a total of 14,444 bags of D Compound and 33,852 bags of Urea fertilizer under the Farmer Input Support Programme for the 2020/2021 farming season in Katete District was not delivered to the beneficiaries;
(b) if so, when the fertilizer will be delivered; and
(c) if the fertilizer will not be delivered, whether the affected farmers will be refunded their contributions to the Programme.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines and Mineral Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has issued any exploration licences for oil and gas in the plains of Western Province;
(b) if so, what the names of the licence holders are; and
(c) when the exploration exercise will commence.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct mortuaries at the following health facilities in Kazungula District:
(i) Kazungula District Hospital; (ii) Nyawa Clinic; (iii) Ngwezi Health Post; (iv) Mukuni Clinic;
(v) Moomba Health Post; (vi) Makunka Clinic; and (vii) Bombwe Health Post;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) what the estimated cost of constructing each mortuary is.
(a) when the Government will electrify the following infrastructure in Lubansenshi Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Tungati Secondary School; (ii) Menga Secondary School; (iii) Luena Secondary School; (iv) Njoko Secondary School;
(v) Ndoki Secondary School; (vi) Matipa Secondary School; (vii) Bemba Secondary School; (viii) Chief Tungati’s Palace; and (ix) Chief Shimumbi’s Palace; and
(b) what has caused the delay in commencing the projects.
(a) how many applicants had pending electricity connections to their premises in Mkushi District, as of July, 2022;
(b) why electricity connections in the District have stalled;
(c) when the exercise will resume; and
(d) what the cause of the delay in resuming the exercise is.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) whether the contract to rehabilitate the Chinsali - Isoka road includes the rehabilitation of the Chinsali Post Office - Nambuluma Turn-Off road; and
(b) if so, when rehabilitation will commence.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to rehabilitate the following primary schools in Chadiza Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Mwangazi; (ii) Msokolela; (iii) Kalemba; and (iv) Mkumbudzi; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) when the Government will rehabilitate the following roads in North Western Province:
(i) Mutanda-Chavuma; (ii) Kasempa-Kaoma Turn-Off; (iii) Kasempa-Mumbwa; (iv) Kalumbila-Mwinilunga;
(v) Mwinilunga-Ikeleng’i; (vi) Manyinga-Mwinilunga; and
(b) what the cost of each project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) what the contract sum for the construction of the Lusaka-Ndola Dual Carriage Way which was cancelled was;
(b) how much of the contract sum was paid before the cancellation;
(c) whether a new contract for the project has been signed; and
(d) if so, what the contract sum is.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to upgrade the Magoye Rural Health Centre to a mini hospital;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why. QUESTION FOR WRITTEN ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 75) W15 Mr Mukosa (Chinsali) - to ask the Minister of Mines and Minerals Development:
(a) which districts in Zambia have the following minerals:
(i) cobalt; (ii) zinc; (iii) tin; (iv) silver; and
(v) lead; and
(b) what measures the Government is taking to promote mining and processing of the minerals listed above. ____________________________
